values: The last post has gotten out of hand...way out of hand!!!! Too many are getting inolved and this has literally won into World War III.
I finally got my iPhoto....that means 7,500 songs and 25,000 pictures!!! Thanks to EVERYONE who put up with my millions of iPod questions...you all rock!

Up until this past year I never knew anyone who committed suicude. Jesse is the second person that I knew. I just found out today that this past weeked he jumped off of the PCH bluffs and killed himself because he was on drugs. He has done drugs for as long as I have known him but I guess since I know so many people that actually do drugs, I did not think that he would kill himself. I always have something to say...but right now I am speechless. Utterly speechless....R.I.P Jesse.....

OMG!!!!!!!!I got accepted to be in the Senate Page Intern Program over the summer so that means 4 weeks in Washington D.C away from my parents and other drama! Now I really cant wait for summer....only 10 more weeks. It seems so close yet it is so far!

AMAZING...no other word can describe this week. I may have come really close to getting hyperthermia and had to sleep in a cramped Expedition because of the rain, but this week long trip to Mexico, to build four houses, with my youth group was one of a kind. It's funny how much you can actually learn about yourself and others when you are in this unique situation. 60 teenagers and 10 adults having to rough it without any real showers, toilets, tvs, stereos, and computers can really take a toll on people. But, I was surprised how the lack of every day necessities can open people's eyes to things that they would not necessarily have noticed had they been in a heated home with access to the internet and cell phone service. Do not get me wrong, I am extremely glad to be back at home with my nice shower and bed, but honestly, part of me wishes I was still down there...

Where do I start??? This weekend has been so awesome! 

~Bowling night fundraiser.....we even had some seniors ditch Senior Bowling Night to come to ours!!! 
~Promenade.....last minute shopping at Macy's and GAP for jeans for Mexico.
~Analee's house.....Baked albino on the inside and black on the outside cookies, watched what I originally thought was called either Internal or External Sunshine, but I later found out it is actually called Eternal Sunshine, and won a pillow fight with Corey.
~Loaded up the vans and sorted dirty smelly tools and tarps that have not been used since last Mexico.


I CANT WAIT FOR TOMORROW!!!!!!! I am going down to Mexico to build houses. Last year was my first year and it was an unforgettable experience. I was talking with a couple of my friends about how much has happened in this past year. We have all changed, mostly for the good....but still change is change. We are not the little freshmen that we were last year. We have grown so much over these past 12 months. Some of us have become closer and others have drifted apart. Some have planned their future and some have not planned what they will wear tomorrow. I cannot help but wonder what we will all be like by the time the next Mexico trip comes around.........

OMG!!!!!!! WAY WAY TO MUCH OF THAT STUPID CAHSEE TESTING! Common...who doesnt know that teh square root of 9 is 3 and who really cares what an ebotonist does?????

On a happier note.....I am leaving for Mexico in 3 days!!!!!!!!!! I CANT WAIT!!!

I finally pulled it off!!!! This is the first surprise party that I planned and the person was actually surprised!!!!!!!! Thanks to everyone who helped, I really appreciated it!


HAPPY BIRTHDAY JEFF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This weekend was well...interesting to say the least. I went up to the mountains with my youth group and it was awesome! In one really long run on sentence we...had snowball fights, made snow angels, hung out in the sleat, rain, hail, snow, got lost on the way to the cabin (in the rain, with our luggage at midnight), watched CP try to buy Brian diapers but the lady would not sell them becuase Brian was not the real kid, saw the guy from 7th Heaven. took pictures with the "little toilest", stole the guys mask, decorated the mask with pink hears and glitter, played with the studded animals in the gift shop, celebrated Jenny's birthday, met new people, taught Jordan how to blowdry her hair, spent an hour and a half drying our clothes, singing Karaoke, and almost getting frostbite/hypothermia.

But, I think that the most interesting part about the was what I learned. Going into this annual retreat, I always seem to think that I will come out of it a better person becuase of what the speaker taught me. But, this year, I came out of it a much better person because of what a 16 year old ex-convict taught me. I did not go looking to learn something from him, he actually found me when he chucked a snowball at me. He made some sort of mistake in his past and that landed him and his younger brother in Juvi. I did not find this fact out until after the snowball fight and I was shocked to learn that. To me he seemed like a perfectly nice guy, I could never imagine him doing something illegal. But, he did and he was recently released for probabation. I am not sure why, but he told me his ENTIRE life story! It seemed to scare almost everyone else in my youth group, but it did not seem to terrify me as much as it did the others. He made me realize that everyone really does make mistakes and that just because someone messes up, that does not necessarily make them a terrible person.

Two congratulations are deserved today........

1. Great job to all of the people who worked on the Rent-A-Date activity. I must say, it was definitely a success! I really appreciated all of your help!

2. Awesome season for the boys basketball teams. You may not have won all of your games, but as the saying goes, it does not matter if you win or loose, it is how you play the game.


R.I.P Mary D.

It is too bad that this weekend it over. Last night I had dinner with Francine...we had a lot of catching up to do. Today, I went to Westwood with Francine and Danielle. Jeff met up with us and then he came back to my house and we watched Love Actually. School is tomorrow :(

I CANNOT BELIVE HOW AWESOME THIS WEEKEND HAS BEEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Yesterday, my finals were done...completely done!!!!!!!!! So, Renata, Neda, Tara and I all went to the Promanade. We then ran into Jonathan and Richard.........wow............people out of school are different.....way different!

According to Kate Spade's book of Manners...."You may start eating before everyone else has if you have hypoglycemia or another medical condition (besides rudeness)."

Then I took the bus up to to Pali and met up with Courtney and Alex. Uni may have lost, but it was still a ton of fun!

Today, I was at church for the majority of the day....I was supposed to be working.....but it actually was more of rocking out to Dustin's oldies mix and hanging out with friends. But, it was a lot safer than last year....( *cough cough*  David catching the towel on fire and throwing it into the trash can) Jeff later stopped by and met Brian and David............awkward..............very awkward!

After, Analee, Brian, David, Abel, Jullian, Robert, Wynn and I all went to the Promanade to see the Boogieman...."Maybe what they said was true.......maybe it really does exist!" A bunch of them taught me to be "Cute Ghetto" but apparently the new term is..........thug! Ha ha.......a bunch of school people would have paid money to see me with the baseball cap to the side with the peace sign!!!!!!!!!!!

 

A while ago I put an poem called I Learned and I decided to make my own........

I have learned that no one is perfect.

I have learned that patience really is a virtue.

I have learned to always give people the benefit of the doubt.

I have learned that the best things in life are worth waiting for.

I have learned that getting there is half the fun.

I have learned that it may be hard to take risks, but in the long run it is worth it.

I have learned that if you put your heart on the line, two things can happen....you can get your heart broken or be rewarded in more ways than words can express.

I have learned that first impressions are not always correct.

I have learned what it is to really be in love.

I should probably be studying for finals...but I have been all day and most of yesterday and I NEED a break. So....congrats to the boys's basketball team for beating ( ha ha...beating is way to nice of a word......destroying the other team!) and the cast of South Pacific...you were all amazing!!!!!!!! GOOD LUCK ON FINALS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Tati's party was great!

Memorable moments:

Me: Have you been driinking tonight? You seem a little tipsy.
Anonymous Person #1: I haven't been drinking at all. I was like this all night..........even before I drank the alcohol.

Anonymous Person #2: I am not drunk I promise! Ask me anything you want!
Me: Ok....how much did you drink?
Anonymous Person #2: I know where you sit in Bio!


Good times.........Good times............

OMG! Basketball is so stressful! I sware, I am going to get an usler if there are any more games as close as tonight! I seriously thought that I might have a heart attack. Thanks goodness that we won.......I was so proud.........especially of Jeff :)
I was driving a few days ago and a Citi Bank billboard said something that is definitely true..."Make today tomorrow's good old days."

I have not had this crappy of a day in such a long time. It was only an hour out of the day, but it sure seemed like an eternity. I just found out that my church's choir director is leaving. I have been part of my church's choir since Pre-K. My church has always been a safe haven for me. No one judges me and everyone has gone from just fellow youth groupies to becoming my family. I love them all dearly and slowly but surely they are all leaving.                                         Everyone knows that I hate to cry, especially infront of people. No matter how sad I may be, I try to act like nothing is really wrong. But when she announced that she had to leave, I startes to sob. I tried really hard to not cry, but all of the my compliants towards my church's changes were so welled up inside of me, that no matter how hard I tried, I could not hold it it. It just sucks to much when you begin to feel so attached to someone and then they decide to leave.......why do people leave? Why do things change?

At tonights youth group, we all discussed blessings and how we were all blessed because of the presence of others in our lives. I know that a lot of us are freaking out about finals and colleges. But, just remember that life is so short and to live it to the fullest. Yes, doing well on your finals and getting into a good college are important, but everything happens for a reason. You were blessed with your family and friends. Therefore, you should spend time with them as much as possible because tomorrow is never guarenteed. Afterall, Jeff reminded me today that it is crucial to live, laugh, and love.  



Inspirational Thought of the Week: "Run your own race."
Quote of the day: " Did you hear, Valentines day is coming early this year!"

I am finally over my stage where I freaked out about college. Well, I am not exactly over it. But, lets just say I will no longer have to vent to people about how freaked out I am. That is because I finally got to talk to Ms. Goldman and she explained that for UCs, any honors class in the A-G requirements count as an extra point for my GPA. I am so excited and that may mean that I can get into UCSB.........

I just wanted to thank everyone who has been putting up with my college ranting these past few days. You all rock. For my sanity.....and yours.....I will try my hardest not to worry as much.

I cannot believe that Winter Break is over. It went by fast....too fast! Oh well. I guess we all can start looking forward to Spring Break.

Today started out great and was great until about 7 when I got home. I went to Jeff's basketball and the varsity games (they both won!!!!!!!!) and then I came home and talked to Analee about colleges. WOW.....that is sure a way to ruin my night! We have discussed it before countless times but for some reason I got really scared. Maybe it was because I had my college handbook out or maybe it was because I realized that I only have 2 and a half more years before I will be enrolled in some college. To be completely honest, I do not know what I am worried about. Maybe it is that I am scared that I will not get into a good school. Maybe it is that I am scared to leave my friends and family. But, I think my biggest fear is that I will study my butt off trying to get into a great school...then get in....and realize that I totally wasted high school! Oh....I dont know what I think.....

Analee had this really cool thing on her livejournal and I decided to do the same ofr me.

15 Things You May Or May Not Know About Me:

1. When you first meet me, I may come off as really quiet. But, that is only because I am shy when I first meet someone. When I begin to feel comfortable around you, you cannot shut me up!
2. Two of my favorite movies are Meet the Parents and Meet the Fockers.
3. I HATE liars and backstabbers! When I feel that I have lost someone's trust, it can be very hard to gain it back.
4. One of my biggest pet peeves is when someone calls and does not leave a message, especially if they are a restricted number.
5. When I was 11 I had a mole removed because the doctor's thought that it was cancerous.
6. The only two things that I am allergic to are bee stings and yams.
7. Ever since I was little I have wanted to be either an actress, psychologist, or in the CIA.
8. I may not be athletic, but I love to go white water rafting and play basketball in the rain.
9. Before I die, I hope to be successful, travel the world, and have a loving family. 
10. I have attended the same church for my entire life and a few of my best friends go there.
11. I would much rather receive a heartfelt gift as opposed to a store bought one. 
12. Over the years I have gained seveal nickames including B-Roach, Great Britannica, and the B-Mister.
13. Sometimes, I wish I could stay a kid forever.
14. Even though I am not back from Winter Break yet, I cannot wait until summer vacation. 
15. My biggest fears in life are loosing the people that I love or not being loved.

The following are two poems that I found in The Chicken Soup for the Soul on Love and Friendship...


Jeff,
These past two months have been great! I love you so much!

You Are All This To Me
by Melissa Collette

Your the thought that starts each morning, 
the conclusion to each day.
You are in all that I do,
and everything I say.

You're the smile on my face,
the twinkle of my eye.
The warmth inside my heart,
the fullness in my life.

You are the hand that's laced in mine,
and the coat upon my back.
My friend, my love, 
my shoulder to lean on.

You're my silly, mature, caring, 
thoughtful, bright, and honest guy.
The one who holds me tightly, 
when I need to cry.

You're the dimple in my cheek,
the ever-constant tingle in my soul.
The voice that makes me weak,
The happiness of my life.

You are all I've wanted,
You are all I need.
You are all I've dreamed of,
You are all of this to me.


To all of my friends,
You are the greatest! I appreciate you all always being there for me especially during these past few weeks!

Why They Are Friends
by Kristy Glassen

Because...they smile.
Because...they understand just by looking into your eyes.
Because...they finish your sentences and know what you like.
Because...they know you better than you know yourself.
Because...with them you aren't afraid to be yourself.
Because...you can say something stupid or expose your deepest secrets to them.
Because...everything you do together becomes a memory.
Because...you don't need to do something special to have fun...fun just happens.
Because...you don't need to explain anything...they just know.
Because...they tell you the truth, no matter how much you'd rather not hear it.
Because...they would do anything for you and get you out of trouble.
Because...they make you laugh harder than anyone.
Because...they are not afraid to put themselves on the line for you.
Because...you can trust them.
Because...they believe in your dreams, no matter how silly they may seem.
Because...they dry your tears.
Because...you are good enough when you are with them.
Because...they love you for who you really are.

These past two days have been awesome! Friday: I did well on my math test, cheered for Jeff at his basketball game (they won and he played a great game) and then we went to see Kenny as Captain Hook in Peter Pan (he was amazing). Today: babysit, set up the nativity scenes on the bluffs, shop for clothes, shop for holiday gifts, youth group and eat WAY to much candy! 

"What just happened? He just happened, he just happened to cross my mind. Without warning he crossed my mind, what just happened to me?"

8 more days until winter break! Wow! I cant wait! This is going to be the best holiday season ever!!! There is so much to look forward to...

U-Town Cool Down (marriage booth...lol), ice-skating, Meet the Fauckers, spending time with Jeff, spending time with friends, spending time with my family, San Francisco (maybe), Santa Maria (maybe), no teachers, no homework, no tests, no waking up early etc....

I have been so busy with school and other stuff that I have not had time to update. But, last Friday was really fun. I went to cheer Jeff and the Uni boys basketball team on,then he came over to my house, and we watched a movie. The rest of the weekend was ok. 
     These have seemed to be the longest two days ever. I have had some kinda flu/cold/who knows what and I feel really crappy. But, I am slowly becoming better and I have to be well to see Kenny's debut as Captain Hook in Peter Pan! I can't wait! 
    I can't wait for Winter Break. 3 weeks of no school, homework, tests, teachers, etc. This break is going to be the greatest. It is finally the holiday season and I already have everything I need (hint: #21). 
    I know that Spring Break is in like 4 months, but Analee wrote a really good article, for her school's newspaper, about last year's trip to Mexico to build houses for people in Tijuana. She told me that I could post her whole article, but it was really long. The last line was definitely the best. It said, "Some people find themselves through writing or gardening, some through music or drawing.  For me, it took a trip to the middle of nowhere to discover what life was really about." I am really looking forward to that trip. I will admit, last year I didn't do too well on the house. I had never been taught how to build anything before. I mean, I really sucked. I was hammering and missed the nail and hit my fingers a few times. But, it was by far one of the best trips I have EVER taken!

Awesome Day.Shopping.Friends.Jeff.Finding Neverland.What could be better?

Today started out with shopping with Analee and we ran into Joanna. She was getting more orange and blue for our spirit days. Then, I met up with Jeff and we saw Finding Neverland. That was such a good movie. Finally, we went to the arcade and he beat me in air hockey (Jeff, we still have to have our rematch...that table was definitely lopsided...lol)

My parents and I are sponsering a UCLA student from Hong Kong and she came over for a late Thanksgiving dinner. I have had so much turkey, mashed potatoes, and stuffing! I am sooo full......but today was a blast!!!!

"Life isn't about keeping score. It is not about how many people call you and it's not about who you've dated, are dating, or haven't dated at all. It isn't about who youve kissed, what sport you play, or which guy or girl likes you. It is not about your shoes or your hair or the color of your skin or where you live or go to school. In fact, it's not about grades, money, clothes, or colleges that accept you or not. Life isn't about if you have lots of friends, or if you are alone, and its not about how accepted or unaccepted you are. Life just isn't about that. 
    But life is about who you love and who you hurt. It's about how you feel about yourself. It's about trust, happiness, and compassion. It's about sticking up for your friends and replacing inner hate with love. Life is about avoiding jelousy, overcoming ignorance and building confidence. It's about what you say and what you mean. It's about seeing people for who they are and not what they have. Most of all, it is about choosing to use your life to touch soneone elses in a way that could never have been achieved otherwise. These choices are what life is about."  

    Yesterday was really fun. After school, Renata came over and we worked on our Survival Guide Project for Ms. Garcia's class. Then, Jeff came over and we played foose ball and watched Meet The Parents. 

    Today was also awesome. First, all of my cousins, aunts, uncles, and grandma got together at the Jonathon Club for a nice brunch at the beach. Then, my parents and I went to Greg's ( a family friend's house ) Malibu beach house and we had another Thanksgiving dinner and got to watch the sunset.

    It is insane how much I have to be thankful for during this holiday season. As corny as it sounds, I really appreciate everyone who has impacted my life in some way or another. So.....to you all.....HAPPY THANKSGIVING!!!!!!!

WOW! The basketball game on Saturday was so much fun. I don't think  I embarrassed anyone :) I was so proud of Jeff. He did awesome! 

Anyways, my parents got my report card and they weren't very happy with my AP Psychology grade or math grade, so I can't use the phone or internet during the week ( so right now I am in Mr. Moody's classroom. I wanted to check my email but its a blocked site. ). But, I guess its ok because  I originally thought that they were going to ground me totally...meaning....no Jeff or friends. But, thank goodness they didn't. 

Besides the new rules, I am really happy. Lets just say this past month has been "swell". 

14 21 ( Jeff, thats for you )

I recently saw this quote on someone's lj and I totally agree with it...

Have you ever noticed that those cheesy love songs aren't so cheesy once you truly know what love is? 

I dont think that they are cheesy anymore......


I tend to overanalyze a lot. I will admit I do (well, I did a lot this past summer and beginning year but I am over that) But it was so funny when Charlie and I were talking about the Livestrong bracelets and why people really buy them and he gave his point. I questioned it and he went into a ton of depth about why it is just a fashion trend and he finished with, "I dont overanalyze, everyone else underanalyzes."

   "Cus' I'm in love with you in love with me...."

  "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving much advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a gentle and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares."

I was searching for some good quotes that would go well with what I was dealing with. I came upon this poem and I really liked it. Some of this lessons really hit  home and others I have never experienced, but I didnt want to chop up the poem.




I've learned....That when you are in love, it shows.

I've learned.... That just one person saying to me, "You've made my day!" makes my day.

I've learned.... That the best classroom in the world is at the feet of an elderly person.

I've learned.... That having a child fall asleep in your arms is one of the most peaceful feelings in the world.

I've learned.... That being kind is more important than being right.

I've learned.... That you should never say no to a gift from a child.

I've learned.... That I can always pray for someone when I don't have the strength to help him in some other way.

I've learned.... That no matter how serious your life requires you to be, everyone needs a friend to act goofy with.

I've learned.... That sometimes all a person needs is a hand to hold and a heart to understand.

I've learned.... That simple walks with my father around the block on summer nights when I was a child did wonders for me as an adult.

I've learned.... That life is like a roll of toilet paper. The closer it gets to the end, the faster it goes.

I've learned.... That we should be glad God doesn't give us everything we ask for.

I've learned.... That money doesn't buy class.

I've learned.... That it's those small daily happenings that make life so spectacular.

I've learned... That under everyone's hard shell is someone who wants to be appreciated and loved.

I've learned.... That the Lord didn't do it all in one day. What makes me think I can?

I've learned.... That to ignore the facts does not change the facts.

I've learned.... That when you plan to get even with someone, you are only letting that person continue to hurt you.

I've learned.... That love, not time, heals all wounds.

I've learned.... That the easiest way for me to grow as a person is to surround myself with people smarter than I am.

I've learned.... That everyone you meet deserves to be greeted with a smile.

I've learned.... That no one is perfect until you fall in love with them.

I've learned.... That life is tough, but I'm tougher.

I've learned.... That opportunities are never lost; someone will take the ones you miss.

I've learned.... That when you harbor bitterness, happiness will dock elsewhere.

I've learned.... That I wish I could have told my Dad that I love him one more time before he passed away.

I've learned.... That one should keep his words both soft and tender, because tomorrow he may have to eat them.

I've learned.... That a smile is an inexpensive way to improve your looks.

I've learned.... That I can't choose how I feel, but I can choose what I do about it.

I've learned.... That when your newly born grandchild holds your little finger in his little fist, that you're hooked for life.

I've learned.... That everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it.

I've learned .. That it is best to give advice in only two circumstances; when it is requested and when it is a life threatening situation.

I've learned.... That the less time I have to work with, the more things I get done.
